imdb.title: Dokutaa Sutoon
imdb.plot: Awakened into a world where humanity has been petrified, scientific genius Senku and his brawny friend Taiju use their skills to rebuild civilization.

episodes.title: Stone Wars Beginning
episodes.plot: Senku continues in trying to advance the Stone World, this time he makes "space food", it is in actuality cup noodles. After Senku finishes his project, Gen has an epiphany and devises a plan to take down Tsukasa's army without violence.

episodes.title: Hot Line
episodes.plot: While Senku's diversion buys Gen and others some time, soon Homura realizes something is not right.

episodes.title: Call from the Dead
episodes.plot: Taiju and Yuzuriha are on the verge of tears after they hear Senku's voice, and Senku informs them of his plan to win the war without any bloodshed.

episodes.title: Full Assault
episodes.plot: Chrome and Magma struggle with Ukyo, while Senku, gets his hands busy with building up an invention; a new hope.

episodes.title: Steam Gorilla
episodes.plot: The final touches to the automobile are made and it is used to transport the science supplies to a fortified cliffside that's close to the Tsukasa empire. From there the automobile is upgraded into a tank, but unbeknownst to the rescue group preparations by the empire have been made to counter any vehicular attack.

episodes.title: Prison Break
episodes.plot: Chrome must use all of his scientific knowledge to escape from his prison and save Senku and others.

episodes.title: Secret Mission
episodes.plot: Chrome makes it back to the Kingdom of Science's base, where he bears witness to the Steam Gorilla for the first time. Meanwhile, with the help of the others and with his fake Lilian voice, Gen manages to convert even more people away from the Tsukasa Empire.

episodes.title: Final Battle
episodes.plot: The Final Battle for the miracle cave starts as Senku and the Kingdom of Science conduct a frontal assault on the cave.

episodes.title: To Destroy and to Save
episodes.plot: Tsukasa and Hyoga are coming to capture the miracle cave. The Kingdom of Science must buy Senku and Chrome some time to turn the tide, or it is all over.

episodes.title: Humanity's Strongest Tag Team
episodes.plot: A truce is called between the Kingdom of Science and Tsukasa Empire. All appears to be well, but some of the Kingdom's dynamite is missing.

episodes.title: Prologue of Dr. Stone
episodes.plot: The Kingdom of Science is victorious, however it is not over for Senku. Senku must use all of his knowledge to cure Tsukasa who is severly injured.

episodes.title: Special: Ryusui
episodes.plot: The Kingdom of Science seeks to set sail on the high seas in their exploration in the name of science. To do so, they must depetrify Ryusui Nanami, a hotshot sailor.

episodes.title: Stone World
episodes.plot: It's been over 3,700 years since a flash of light petrified nearly all human life. A 16-year-old genius named Senku Ishigami is suddenly revived to find himself in a world where all traces of human civilization have been eroded by time.

episodes.title: King of the Stone World
episodes.plot: After discover how liberty peoples from stones, Senku and Taiji decides who he's will free up first, and a series of events influence then to liberty a very strong boy, named Shishio.

episodes.title: Weapons of Science
episodes.plot: Senku does not trust the motivation of Shishio, so he will try to hide his plans from a new and unforeseen enemy for his plan to revive civilization.

episodes.title: Fire the Smoke Signal
episodes.plot: Senku makes gunpowder to defeat Tsukasa. The gunpowder explodes and a smoke signal is made. Yuzuriha notices another smoke signal. Senku must decide to either cause more explosions as signals but risk revealing his position to Tsukasa.

episodes.title: Stone World the Beginning
episodes.plot: Taiju and Yuzuriha flee from Tsukasa while taking Senku with them. It is discovered how Senku survived his first days after being freed from petrifaction.

episodes.title: Two Nations of the Stone World
episodes.plot: Senku awakens after being nearly killed by Tsukasa and suggests splitting up with Yuzuriha and Taiju so they can spy on Tsukasa. A girl fights Tsukasa but is defeated and trapped under a tree. Senku finds the same girl and helps her.

episodes.title: Where Two Million Years Have Gone
episodes.plot: Senku helps Kohaku bring hot water back to her village for her ill sister. Kohaku tells Senku about her village and that it has forty people. Senku is told he cannot enter the village. Senku explains to Chrome about the history of mankind.

episodes.title: Stone Road
episodes.plot: Senku wants to make antibiotics and he explains how to Chrome and Kohaku. Senku decides to use magnets to collect iron. A child named Suika offers to help Senku. Senku decides to make ramen to appease the villagers and use their manpower.

episodes.title: Let There Be The Light Of Science
episodes.plot: Senku feeds the villagers ramen so they can help him make iron. Senku meets Asagiri Gen a man who's been unpetrified and is working for Tsukasa. Asagiri decides to help Senku. Senku wants to make a generator with the help of lightning.

episodes.title: A Flimsy Alliance
episodes.plot: After Gen is brutally beaten in a surprise attack, Kohaku devises a plan to bring down the attacker once and for all.

episodes.title: Clear World
episodes.plot: Suika never wants to show her face for some reason that only a few know. Fortunately, Senku knows the solution to his annoying problem.

episodes.title: Buddies Back to Back
episodes.plot: To recover the most problematic ingredient in order to create sulfonamides, Ginro, Chrome, Kohaku and Senku will head to a zone of maximum danger. What kind of enemy will stand before them?

episodes.title: Masked Warrior
episodes.plot: All that's needed to make antibiotics is alcohol. The best way to get some is to win the Grand Bout, which the Senku and his kingdom will also need to do in order to keep Magma away from Ruri and give her the drug.

episodes.title: Master of Flame
episodes.plot: After Magma's series of tricks to reach the final match, Chrome reveals a trick of his own. With a little extra help from Gen, Chrome just may be able to pull this one off.

episodes.title: The Culmination of Two Million Years
episodes.plot: After Senku's unlikely victory, quick marriage, and even hastier divorce, the kingdom of science is back to work to finally finish Ruri's medicine.

episodes.title: A Tale for the Ages
episodes.plot: Ruri reveals the origin of the village's name and Senku learns of his father's fate.

episodes.title: A Hundred Nights and a Thousand Skies
episodes.plot: Byakuya and the astronauts' story continues, and Senku's connection to Ishigami Village and the Hundred Tales is finally revealed.

episodes.title: Stone Wars
episodes.plot: Tsukasa's army is coming. Kinro struggles to hold the bridge against the deadly spearman Hyoga and his shock troops, but Senku and the villagers are ready with deadly new weapons of science.

episodes.title: To Modernity
episodes.plot: Hyoga is disarmed, but the kingdom of science is still in danger - Ishigami village is in flames. And Tsukasa will soon know that Senku is still alive - How will the villagers fight off the coming invasion?

episodes.title: The Age of Energy
episodes.plot: Work begins on creating the components for Senku's cell phone, but spinning gold wire is proving to be quite the task! Luckily, Chrome and Kaseki "invent" the water wheel and drastically improve the process!

episodes.title: Spartan Crafts Club
episodes.plot: With stored electricity, Senku takes the logical next step and creates light bulbs. After a little trial and error, Senku displays the new lights on a Christmas tree!

episodes.title: The Treasure
episodes.plot: Senku, Chrome, and Magma venture into a cave to search for Tungsten; a suspicious accident leaves Senku and Magma trapped at the bottom of a pit.

episodes.title: Wave of Science
episodes.plot: Senku and the rest of the village get to work on making the components for the cell phone. It's hard work but everyone is pumped!

episodes.title: Voices Over Infinite Distance
episodes.plot: After a successful test of their new cell phone, Senku learns of a mysterious tale about a bee named Speaker who can play the voices of the dead.
